snippet: The pharmaceutical company and a subsidiary will pay a total of $60 million to resolve accusations that it paid doctors in several countries to prescribe its drugs.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission announces that it has reached a $45 million settlement with Pfizer to resolve charges that subsidiaries of Pfizer and Wyeth bribed overseas doctors and other health care workers to increase sales of their drugs; announcement comes as the Justice Department announces that another Pfizer subsidiary has agreed to pay $15 million to settle similar charges.
lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical company and a subsidiary will pay a total of $60 million to resolve accusations that it paid doctors in several countries to prescribe its drugs.

headline.seo: Pfizer Settles U.S. Charges of Overseas Bribery
headline.main: Pfizer Settles U.S. Charges of Bribing Doctors Abroad
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Settles U.S. Charges Of Bribing Doctors Abroad
